intro: Culcita villosa, commonly known as the hairy culcita, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in shades of pink or red. Culcita villosa is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
